name: Friends of KDSP
mission: Friends of KDSP supports the empowerment of the Down syndrome community in Pakistan by providing quality developmental services to individuals with Down syndrome and promoting and advocating for their inclusion in mainstream society.
theoryOfChange: Providing a one-stop solution of high-quality, subsidized developmental and healthcare services to enable individuals with Down syndrome to become independent and contributing members of society.
zakatClaimEvidence: On the Friends of KDSP donation page, under 'Select a campaign', 'Zakat' is explicitly listed as an option. Additionally, a YouTube video titled 'Transform lives, with your Zakat with Friends of KDSP' encourages zakat donations to the organization. The KDSP donation page, which directs US donors to Friends of KDSP, also explicitly states 'We accept Zakat' and provides 'Zakat' as a donation type option. (Source: https://friendsofkdsp.org/donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.improvement_suggestion: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 29/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: Friends of Kdsp shows good alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence: On the Friends of KDSP donation page, under 'Select a campaign', 'Zakat' is explicitly listed as an option. Additionally, a YouTube video titled 'Transform lives, with your Zakat with Friends of KDSP' encourages zakat donations to the organization. The KDSP donation page, which directs US donors to Friends of KDSP, also explicitly states 'We accept Zakat' and provides 'Zakat' as a donation type option. (Source: https://friendsofkdsp.org/donate/)

all_citations.claim: The organization reported total revenue of $655,185, a program expense ratio of 60.4%, working capital of 28.5 months, and fundraising efficiency of $0.29 per $1 raised.
Financial profile metadata confirms the organization's revenue and expense reporting structure.
Friends of Kdsp operates programs including Sehat Healthcare and Early Childhood Intervention, focusing on therapy sessions and mainstream school integration.
The organization provides donation options and is identified as Zakat-eligible.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate score of 54/100, reflecting strong financial stability and efficient fundraising balanced against a need for greater data transparency and higher direct program spending.
areas_for_improvement: Enhance transparency and data reporting to improve low data confidence levels [1].
Increase the proportion of revenue directed toward direct program expenses to maximize impact [1][2].

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 29/50, the charity addresses an urgent global education and healthcare need for an underserved population [3]. It offers a medium fit for donors, specifically providing Zakat-eligible pathways for those looking to support disability rights and inclusion in Pakistan [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through programs like Sehat Healthcare and Early Childhood Intervention, operating with a cost per beneficiary of approximately $123.88 [1][3]. While it successfully schedules weekly therapy sessions and integrates children into mainstream schools, the overall impact score of 25/50 is limited by a program expense ratio of 60.4% and low data confidence [1][2][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Friends of Kdsp empowers the Down syndrome community in Pakistan through specialized healthcare, early intervention, and educational integration.
strengths: Maintains a robust working capital of 28.5 months, ensuring long-term operational stability [1].
Demonstrates high fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.29 per $1 raised [1].
Offers Zakat-eligible giving options to support its specialized programs [4].
baseline_narrative.summary: Friends of Kdsp is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting individuals with Down syndrome in Pakistan by providing essential services and fostering an inclusive society [3]. The organization reported a total revenue of $655,185 and maintains a program expense ratio of 60.4% to fund its core mission [1][2].

The board is currently <cite id="14">limited to 3 members</cite>, which is below the standard for robust non-profit oversight.

bbb_assessment.summary: This organization has not been evaluated by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is an emerging institution that has shown consistent growth in service delivery metrics since 2014.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="13">limited transparency</cite> and a small governance board.

confidence.notes: While financial health is strong, transparency and governance metrics are below institutional standards.

alignment.explanation: The charity is a <cite id="17">zakat-eligible organization</cite> serving the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin) within a high-urgency cause area.
alignment.improvement: Clarifying the <cite id="17">zakat allocation policy</cite> would help Muslim donors better understand how their funds are utilized.

credibility.explanation: Credibility is supported by <cite id="1">over a decade of operations</cite> and consistent filing of <cite id="2">Form 990 tax returns</cite>, though data confidence remains low due to a lack of external audits.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should <cite id="13">publish audited financial statements</cite> and expand its board of directors.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="15">cost-per-beneficiary of $123.88</cite> and a focus on capacity building through <cite id="5">specialized therapy and education</cite>.
impact.improvement: The organization could improve its impact score by <cite id="16">documenting a clear theory of change</cite> with explicit causal pathways.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service provider, not a grantmaker

rich_narrative.headline: Friends of Kdsp empowers the Down syndrome community in Pakistan through specialized healthcare, early intervention, and educational integration.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support specialized disability services in Pakistan through a zakat-eligible organization with strong financial reserves.
donor_motivations: Want to support the Down syndrome community specifically
Value long-term organizational stability and high reserves
Prefer funding direct service delivery like therapy and schooling
Seek to fulfill zakat obligations through niche humanitarian causes
giving_considerations: The organization is in a growth phase with limited external evaluation
Donations support a highly specialized, niche population
Financial transparency is currently limited compared to larger international NGOs
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors who require rigorous third-party RCT evidence or those seeking large-scale international disaster relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects consistent internal tracking of outputs like therapy sessions and school placements, but lacks independent impact assessments.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization creates impact by providing early intervention and therapy to improve developmental outcomes, followed by teacher training to facilitate school integration.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that specialized therapies are resulting in long-term independence for children with Down syndrome.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a revenue of $655,185 and expanding therapy needs, the organization has significant capacity to scale its programs across Pakistan.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="6">80% mainstream school integration rate</cite>.
peer_comparison.peer_group: Disability Support Organizations in South Asia

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focus on sports and physical activity
similar_organizations.name: Special Olympics Pakistan

strengths.detail: The organization maintains <cite id="7">28.5 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer for long-term operational continuity.
Friends of Kdsp demonstrates lean operations with a <cite id="8">fundraising efficiency of $0.29 per $1 raised</cite>.
The charity has successfully trained <cite id="9">170 teachers in inclusive education</cite> to support classroom integration.

strengths_deep_dive: Friends of Kdsp excels in creating a holistic ecosystem for the Down syndrome community. Their impact is evidenced by <cite id="10">490 facilitated healthcare referrals</cite> and the graduation of <cite id="11">35 children from specialized preschool programs</cite>. The organization's ability to scale is reflected in their therapy metrics, which grew from <cite id="12">340 weekly sessions in 2020</cite> to over <cite id="5">740 sessions by 2024</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Friends of Kdsp is a specialized non-profit organization dedicated to the empowerment of the Down syndrome community in Pakistan. Founded in <cite id="1">2014</cite>, the organization provides a comprehensive support system that includes healthcare, early childhood intervention, and educational integration. In the 2023 fiscal year, the charity reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $655,185</cite>, primarily driven by public contributions. The organization operates with a unique financial structure, reporting a <cite id="3">60.4% program expense ratio</cite> in its primary financial filings, though third-party analysis suggests a more conservative <cite id="4">60.4% allocation to direct programs</cite>. Friends of Kdsp facilitates critical services such as <cite id="5">740 weekly therapy sessions</cite> and has achieved an <cite id="6">80% mainstream school integration rate</cite> for its beneficiaries. By focusing on capacity building and family support, the organization addresses a significant gap in Pakistan's social services sector, ensuring that individuals with Down syndrome can lead independent and fulfilling lives.
